flow.descriptionCdata:
29baf272-4192-4862-9436-2c6f601b42a9.17500cb5-3f60-4e1b-a095-2292cca482ed.prompt=Email From\: 29baf272-4192-4862-9436-2c6f601b42a9.1bc290f9-72e2-4819-a493-6ab4420aec31.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal

29baf272-4192-4862-9436-2c6f601b42a9.49145bf1-4e6e-430b-89b9-5de6863c7744.prompt=Content to write\: 29baf272-4192-4862-9436-2c6f601b42a9.63b05048-6bf0-4864-958d-e0a43c7f197b.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:

29baf272-4192-4862-9436-2c6f601b42a9.6952c488-d58c-4b77-aced-6c123a28deaf.prompt=File to write ${subject} to\: 29baf272-4192-4862-9436-2c6f601b42a9.7a76aed2-ad9a-4b3a-9095-a42ceb595af4.prompt=Email To\: 29baf272-4192-4862-9436-2c6f601b42a9.944af193-9db5-4991-8a76-20d8733a35bf.prompt=Notification option\: 29baf272-4192-4862-9436-2c6f601b42a9.9ced320c-d5f2-4ae7-b856-c33f2712c8bb.description=
Writes the data from "contents" input to the requested file. The operation can be used to overwrite existing content of the file,  append extra lines to it or even create a new file.

Input Parameters\:
source           -  Full path to file. If the file does not exist it is created first.
contents        - The contents to write to the file. Contents can have a new line delimiter which is also given as input to the operation, but it is optional. Example\: "This is line no. 01\nThis is line no. 2\n" where \n is the delimiter.
delimiter         - Specifies the newline delimiter (\n, \r\n, etc) that is used for the "contents" input.
characterSet  - The character encoding used to write to the file. The default is UTF-8. Example values\: windows-1252, UTF-16, UTF-16BE,  ISO-8859-1, US-ASCII, Shift_JIS etc.
overwrite       - Specifies whether to overwrite the file or append to it. By default, the used value is true. Accepted values\: true, false or the empty string. If this is left empty, the file will be overwritten.

Responses\:
success - file/directory is written successfully
failure   - unable to write to file/directory
29baf272-4192-4862-9436-2c6f601b42a9.9d1270ce-dedd-4a78-847b-5c3f329a47d6.prompt=Mail host\: 29baf272-4192-4862-9436-2c6f601b42a9.a76e96ec-eb61-4b3d-9182-b55aba6ac6ac.description=
Sends an smtp email.
 
Inputs\:
    hostname - The hostname or ip address of the smtp server.
    port - The port smtp service is listening.
    from - From email address.
    to - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients.
    cc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the CC.
    bcc - A delimiter separated list of email address(es) or recipients, to be placed in the BCC.
    subject - The email subject. If a subject spans on multiple lines, it is formatted to a single one.
    body - The body of the email.
    htmlEmail - Default value is true. The value should be true if the email is in rich text/html format. The value should be false if the email is in plain text format.
    readReceipt - Default is false. The value should be true if read receipt is required, else false.
    attachments - A deliimiter separated list of files to attach (must be full path).
    username - If SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send.
    password - The password to use.
    characterSet - The character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8.
    contentTransferEncoding - The content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
    delimiter - A delimiter to separate the email recipients and the attachments. The default value is mentioned in the Send Mail operation description.
 
Responses\:
    success - Successfully sent the email.
    failure - Failed to send the email.

Note\:
1. For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
2. For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
29baf272-4192-4862-9436-2c6f601b42a9.d212cf9c-6a04-4ffe-bec0-840e63471a01.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
29baf272-4192-4862-9436-2c6f601b42a9.description=
This flow sends, stores or displays a notification message according to your notification type selection. You can use this flow to select how to be notified about the outcome of other flows. 

Inputs\:
    notifyData -  The content of the notification message.
    notifyMethod - The notification type. This value is not case sensitive.
Valid values\: Write to File, Email, Display or None
    subject - A summary of the notification content. 
    destination - The destination of the notification. You must specify a value for this input if "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’ or ‘Write to File’.
Valid values\: An email address or a file name
    notificationServer - The email server used to send the notification email message. If "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’, you must specify a value for this input.
    from - The email address of the sender of the notification email message.  If "notifyMethod" is set to ‘Email’, you must specify a value for this input.
    serverPort - The notification service’s server port. This field’s value is used when the "notifyMethod" is ‘Email’, but it is optional.
Default value\: 25
    htmlEmail - The value should be true if the email is in rich text/HTML format. The value should be false to send the email in plain text format.
Default value\: true

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
    To schedule a flow that uses this flow, you need to supply all the required fields for the used notification method. For example, if "notifyMethod" is set to ‘File’, the "destination" input must also be specified.

Examples\:
    This is a valid input example for storing a notification message to a file\:
      notifyData\: notificationContent
      notifyMethod\: Write to File
      subject\: notificationSubject
      destination\: C\:\Program File\notification.txt
29baf272-4192-4862-9436-2c6f601b42a9.fa187a0a-f21b-4e39-8c99-2151de47905e.prompt=${notifyData}
flow.name: Notify

scriptlet.name: Step Display Message: success in Flow Notify (fa187a0a-f21b-4e39-8c99-2151de47905e)
